translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fourth Section
The Discussion of Characteristics
Is a being who possesses the characteristics a Bodhisatta?
Yes.

analyzed: padesa lakkhaṇehi samannāgato padesa bodhisatto ti
translated: Is a being who possesses the characteristics of a part a Bodhisatta?
That cannot be said.
Is a being who possesses the characteristics a Bodhisatta?
Yes.

analyzed: ti bhāga lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ ti bhāga bodhisatto ti
translated: Is a being who possesses the characteristics of three parts a Bodhisatta?
That cannot be said.
Is a being who possesses the characteristics a Bodhisatta?
Yes.

analyzed: upaḍḍha lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ upaḍḍha bodhisatto ti
translated: Is a being who possesses the characteristics of half a Bodhisatta?
That cannot be said.
Is a being who possesses the characteristics a Bodhisatta?
Yes.

analyzed: cakkavatti satto lakkhaṇa samannāgato cakkavatti satto bodhisatto ti
translated: Is a being who is a Wheel-turning Monarch and possesses the characteristics a Bodhisatta?
That cannot be said.

analyzed: cakkavatti satto lakkhaṇa samannāgato cakkavatti satto bodhisatto ti
translated: Is a being who is a Wheel-turning Monarch and possesses the characteristics a Bodhisatta?
Yes.

original: Yādiso bodhisattassa pubbayogo pubbacariyā dhammakkhānaṁ dhammadesanā, tādiso cakkavattisattassa pubbayogo pubbacariyā dhammakkhānaṁ dhammadesanāti?
analyzed: yādisaḥ bodhisattassa pubba yogaḥ pubba cariyā dhammakkhānam dhamma desanā tādisaḥ cakkavatti sattassa pubba yogaḥ pubba cariyā dhammakkhānam dhamma desanā ati
translated: Is the Great Being’s previous effort, practice, and cultivation of the Dhamma the same as the Universal Monarch’s previous effort, practice, and cultivation of the Dhamma?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa devā paṭhamaṁ paṭiggaṇhanti pacchā manussā, evamevaṁ cakkavattisattassa jāyamānassa devā paṭhamaṁ paṭiggaṇhanti pacchā manussāti?
analyzed: yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa devā paṭhamam paṭiggaṇhanti pacchā manussā evam evam cakkavatti sattassa jāyamānassa devā paṭhamam paṭiggaṇhanti pacchā manussā ati
translated: “Is it the case that just as the gods receive the Bodhisatta first and then humans, so too the gods receive the Great Being first and then humans?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa cattāro naṁ devaputtā paṭiggahetvā mātu purato ṭhapenti—🔽“attamanā, devi, hohi.
analyzed: yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa cattāraḥ nam deva puttā paṭiggahetvā mātu puratas ṭhapenti  attamanāḥ devi hohi
translated: “Is it the case that just as four gods receive the Bodhisatta and place him in front of his mother, saying,

original: Mahesakkho te putto uppanno”ti, evamevaṁ cakkavattisattassa jāyamānassa cattāro naṁ devaputtā paṭiggahetvā mātu purato ṭhapenti—🔽“attamanā, devi, hohi.
analyzed: mahesakkhaḥ te putto uppanno ti evam evam cakkavatti sattassa jāyamānassa cattāro nam deva puttā paṭiggahetvā mātu puratas ṭhapenti  attamanāḥ devi hohi
translated: ‘Rejoice, Queen, a great being has been born to you,’ so too four gods receive the Great Being and place him in front of his mother, saying,
‘Rejoice, Queen, a great being has been born to you’?”
“That can’t be said.”🔽“Is it the case that just as the Bodhisatta is born from his mother’s right side, so too the Great Being is born from his mother’s right side?”

original: Yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa dve udakassa dhārā antalikkhā pātubhavanti—
analyzed: yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa dve udakassa dhārāḥ antalikkhā pātubhavanti
translated: Just as when the Bodhisatta was being born, two streams of water appeared in the sky,
one cool, the other warm,

original: yena bodhisattassa udakakiccaṁ karonti mātu ca, evamevaṁ cakkavattisattassa jāyamānassa dve udakassa dhārā antalikkhā pātubhavanti—
analyzed: yena bodhisattassa udaka kiccam karonti mātu ca evam evam cakkavatti sattassa jāyamānassa dve udakassa dhārāḥ antalikkhā pātubhavanti
translated: which performed a bathing ritual for the Bodhisatta and his mother, so too it is for the being who is to be reborn as a wheel-turning monarch. Two streams of water appear in the sky,
one cool, the other warm,

original: yena cakkavattisattassa udakakiccaṁ karonti mātu cāti?
analyzed: yena cakkavatti sattassa udaka kiccam karonti mātu ca ati
translated: which perform a bathing ritual for the being who is to be reborn as a wheel-turning monarch and his wife.”
“That can’t be right,” …

analyzed: yathā sampati jātaḥ bodhisattaḥ samehi pādehi patiṭṭhahitvā uttarena abhimukhaḥ satta pada vītihārena
translated: “Just as the Bodhisatta, as soon as he was born, stood firm on his feet, took seven steps to the north,

analyzed: gacchati setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne sabbā ca disā viloketi āsabhiḥ ca vācam bhāsati
translated: and, while a white parasol was held over him, he surveyed all the directions and uttered the lion’s roar:

analyzed: aggaḥ uham asmi lokassa jeṭṭhaḥ uham asmi lokassa seṭṭhaḥ uham asmi lokassa ayam antimā jāti
translated: ‘I am the chief in the world, the best in the world, the highest in the world. This is my last birth.

original: natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti, evamevaṁ sampatijāto cakkavattisatto samehi pādehi patiṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ ti evam evam sampatijātaḥ cakkavatti satto samehi pādehi patiṭṭhahitvā
translated: In the same way, as soon as the wheel-turning monarch is born, he stands up on his feet,

original: uttarena abhimukho sattapadavītihārena gacchati setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne, sabbā
analyzed: uttarena abhimukhaḥ satta padavī tihārena gacchati setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne sabbā
translated: walks seven steps to the north,

original: ca disā viloketi, āsabhiñca vācaṁ bhāsati—
analyzed: ca disā vilokā iti āsabhiḥ ca vācam bhāsati
translated: looks in all directions, and says these words of a great man:

original: “aggohamasmi lokassa, jeṭṭhohamasmi lokassa, seṭṭhohamasmi lokassa, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti?
analyzed: aggaḥ ham asmi lokassa jeṭṭhaḥ ham asmi lokassa seṭṭhaḥ ham asmi lokassa ayam antimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ ti
translated: ‘I am the chief in the world. I am the supreme in the world. I am the first in the world. This is my last birth. There is now no continuation of existence.’”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa mahato ālokassa mahato obhāsassa mahato bhūmicālassa
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  yathā bodhisattassa jāyamānassa mahataḥ ālokassa mahataḥ obhāsassa mahataḥ bhūmicālassa
translated: “You shouldn’t say that.”🔽“Just as there is a great light, a great radiance, and a great earthquake

original: pātubhāvo hoti, evamevaṁ cakkavattisattassa jāyamānassa mahato ālokassa mahato obhāsassa
analyzed: pātubhāvaḥ hoti evam evam cakkavatti sattassa jāyamānassa mahataḥ ālokassa mahataḥ obhāsassa
translated: when the Bodhisatta is born, in the same way, there is a great light, a great radiance, and a great earthquake
when the wheel-turning monarch is born.”
“You shouldn’t say that.”

original: Yathā bodhisattassa pakatikāyo samantā byāmaṁ obhāsati, evamevaṁ cakkavattisattassa pakatikāyo samantā byāmaṁ obhāsatīti?
analyzed: yathā bodhisattassa pakati kāyo samantā byāmam obhāsati evam evam cakkavatti sattassa pakati kāyo samantā byāmam obhāsati iti
translated: Is it that the ordinary body of the Bodhisatta shines forth all around a fathom, and likewise the ordinary body of the Wheel-turning Monarch shines forth all around a fathom?”
“That is not so.” …

translated: “Is it that the Bodhisatta dreams the Great Dream, and likewise the Wheel-turning Monarch dreams the Great Dream?”
“That is not so.” …
“It may be that the Bodhisatta is endowed with the marks,
“Yes.”

original: Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“dvattiṁsimāni, bhikkhave, mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā  bhikkhave mahā purisassa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yehi samannāgatassa mahā purisassa dvā iva gatiyaḥ bhavanti anaññā
translated: “But was it not said by the Blessed One:

original: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
analyzed: sace agāram ajjhāvasati rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā cāturantaḥ vijitāvī janapadatthāvariya ppatto satta ratana samannāgato
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, there are these thirty-two marks of a great man. A great man who possesses them all, if he lives the home life, becomes a Wheel-turning Monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, master of the four quarters, all-victorious, who has stabilised his country and possesses the seven treasures.
He has these seven treasures:🔽the wheel treasure, the elephant treasure, the horse treasure, the jewel treasure, the woman treasure, the steward treasure, and the counsellor treasure as the seventh.

original: cakkaratanaṁ, hatthiratanaṁ, assaratanaṁ, maṇiratanaṁ, itthiratanaṁ, gahapatiratanaṁ, pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
analyzed: cakka ratana hatthi ratana assa ratana maṇi ratana itthi ratana gahapati ratana pariṇāyaka ratanam eva sattama
translated: the elephant treasure, the horse treasure, the jewel treasure, the woman treasure, the steward treasure, and the military commander treasure as the seventh.

original: Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.
analyzed: parosahassam kho panassa puttāḥ bhavanti sūrāḥ vīraṅga rūpāḥ para sena ppamaddanāḥ
translated: He has more than a thousand sons who are heroes, of heroic stature, conquerors of the populace, and who rout the armies of others.

original: So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: saḥ imam pathavim sāgara pariyantam a daṇḍena a satthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati
translated: He dwells having conquered this earth out to the ocean’s shore, without stick or sword, through the rule of the Dhamma.

original: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭṭacchado”ti.
analyzed: sace kho pana agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati araham hoti sammāsambuddhaḥ loke vivaṭṭa chadā iti
translated: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes an Accomplished One, a Fully Enlightened One, who draws back the veil from the world.’
Is there a discourse on this?”
“Yes, there is.”

analyzed: tena hi lakkhaṇa samannāgataḥ bodhisatto ti
translated: “Well then, the Bodhisatta is endowed with the marks.”
The Discussion of the Marks is finished.
